thread.title: Maureen O'Hara, star of The Quiet Man, dies aged 95 - Movies
thread.title_full: Maureen O'Hara, star of The Quiet Man, dies aged 95 - Movies News - Digital Spy

author: Sam Warner
title: Maureen O'Hara, star of The Quiet Man, dies aged 95 - Movies
text: Irish-American actress Maureen O'Hara, known as 'The Queen of Technicolor', has died at the age of 95.O'Hara was best known for her role in The Quiet Man opposite star John Wayne, which was directed by John Ford. © Getty ImagesMaureen O'Hara at the 2014 Golden Globes She died today at her home in Idaho, and her family confirmed in a statement that she had passed away "in her sleep of natural causes" surrounded by her family "listening to music from her favourite movie, The Quiet Man"."Her characters were feisty and fearless, just as she was in real life. She was also proudly Irish and spent her entire lifetime sharing her heritage and the wonderful culture of the Emerald Isle with the world. Later in life, she became the first woman president of a commercially scheduled airline in the United States," they said."While we mourn the loss of a very wonderful woman, we also celebrate her remarkable life and hope that it serves as an example to young people around the world, especially in Ireland, to work hard to make their dreams come true and to always have the courage to stand up for themselves."For those who may ask what they can do to honour Maureen, we have a simple request: visit Ireland one day and think of her." © Getty ImagesJohn Wayne and Maureen O'Hara in The Quiet Man The star was born Maureen FitzSimons in Dublin in 1920 and was the eldest of six children. She moved to Hollywood in 1936 and gained dual US citizenship in 1946.As well as starring opposite John Wayne in a number of films, she was also famous for How Green Was My Valley.Stars including Jessica Chastain have paid tribute to the Quiet Man star:RIP #MaureenOHara from one tough redhead broad to another. Thankful for the light you shared https://t.co/TFX3GkJVi4 pic.twitter.com/ExAupBOIFc— Jessica Chastain (@jes_chastain) October 24, 2015Maureen O'Hara, may you rest in peace my dear friend. You will always be Ireland's greatest movie star.— Michael Flatley (@MichaelFlatley) October 24, 2015What an inspiration this great spirited Irish actress was to me . God speed Maureen O Hara R.I.P #maureenohara pic.twitter.com/vweabl1bWr— Roma Downey (@RealRomaDowney) October 24, 2015 How Green Was My Valley is one of my favourites movies. Nostalgia by John Ford. Today we lose #MaureenOHara the silver screen has lost a myth— Nina Garcia (@ninagarcia) October 24, 2015
